result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan R. Cruz Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 117 days served if revoked.
Probation may transfer to Georgia.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  No THC.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan R. Cruz Jr.

records.addlTxt: DE to be released as to this case.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Balistrieri.  Clerk. M.Burke. DE pleads guilty. Court finds DE guilty. Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 1 year with conditions; Credit for 117 days served if revoked. Court allows transfer of probation to GA. DE to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge. DE to pay $100 DV surcharge.
Information letter regarding possible treatment program

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody by zoom and appeared in court w/ Attorney F. Balistrieri.   Clerk. M.Burke.  State in victim rights compliance.  PLEAS set for 05/16/22 at 2:30. Bond cont.

Defendant Juan R. Cruz appeared with Attorney Francesco J Balistrieri.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 2.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 2 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
